In recent weeks, the debate has intensified on the reduction of the criminal majority in Brazil from 18 years to 16 years of age.
Reducing the age of criminality will not solve the problem of juvenile delinquency. This does not mean that I am in favor of impunity.
Minors who commit some type of crime must submit to socio-educational measures, which in severe cases already impose deprivation of liberty.
To this end, the country has advanced legislation: the Child and Adolescent Statute, which can always be improved.
I believe that the time has come to extend the debate to change the legislation.
The law must be tightened up, but it must be punished more strictly by adults who encourage minors for organized crime.
Boys and girls place is at school. Enough of impunity for those who lure children and adolescents to crime.
